page.title: 18Chestnut Farm. Coalpit Heath
page.content: Chestnut farm is owned by Mr. Poole. Mr. Poole has been farming here for 38 years. Chestnut farm is very big in fact it is 250 acres. It is a hard job to manage so large a farm with only his son and one other man to help him. The farm has a hundred cows and as many calves making two hundred head of cattle in all. They have a milking parlour and produce about 260 gallons of milk each day. The cows are milked at 6.00am and 4.00pm. When the cows are about 2\ years old they are ready to have a calf and after this they can be milked. Mr. Poole has one bull called Superstar on his farm. They also grow crops on Chestnut farm. They grow wheat, barley and corn. About one third of the farm is given over to this purpose whilst the remainder is used for the livestock.
